segment.source: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)
segment.target: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.

segment.source: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Creating an AppHelp Message in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool enables you to create an AppHelp text message.

segment.source: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.
segment.target: This is a blocking or non-blocking message that appears when a user starts an application that you know has major functionality issues on the Windows® operating system.

segment.source: Blocking Versus Non-Blocking AppHelp Messages
segment.target: Blocking Versus Non-Blocking AppHelp Messages

segment.source: A blocking AppHelp message prevents the application from starting and displays a message to the user.
segment.target: A blocking AppHelp message prevents the application from starting and displays a message to the user.

segment.source: You can define a specific URL where the user can download an updated driver or other fix to resolve the issue.
segment.target: You can define a specific URL where the user can download an updated driver or other fix to resolve the issue.

segment.source: When using a blocking AppHelp message, you must also define the file-matching information to identify the version of the application and enable the corrected version to continue.
segment.target: When using a blocking AppHelp message, you must also define the file-matching information to identify the version of the application and enable the corrected version to continue.

segment.source: A non-blocking AppHelp message does not prevent the application from starting, but provides a message to the user including information such as security issues, updates to the application, or changes to the location of network resources.
segment.target: A non-blocking AppHelp message does not prevent the application from starting, but provides a message to the user including information such as security issues, updates to the application, or changes to the location of network resources.

segment.source: Searching for Existing Compatibility Fixes
segment.target: Searching for Existing Compatibility Fixes

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool has preloaded fixes for many common applications, including known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool has preloaded fixes for many common applications, including known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.

segment.source: Before you create a new AppHelp message, you can search for an existing application and then copy and paste the known fixes into your custom database.
segment.target: Before you create a new AppHelp message, you can search for an existing application and then copy and paste the known fixes into your custom database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: You must use the 32-bit version to create custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to create custom databases for 64-bit applications.
segment.target: You must use the 32-bit version to create custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to create custom databases for 64-bit applications.

segment.source: To search for an existing application
segment.target: To search for an existing application

segment.source: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the Applications folder and search for your application name.
segment.target: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the Applications folder and search for your application name.

segment.source: Click the application name to view the preloaded AppHelp messages, compatibility fixes, and compatibility modes.
segment.target: Click the application name to view the preloaded AppHelp messages, compatibility fixes, and compatibility modes.

segment.source: Creating a New AppHelp Message
segment.target: Creating a New AppHelp Message

segment.source: If you are unable to find a preloaded AppHelp message for your application, you can create a new one for use by your custom database.
segment.target: If you are unable to find a preloaded AppHelp message for your application, you can create a new one for use by your custom database.

segment.source: To create a new AppHelp message
segment.target: To create a new AppHelp message

segment.source: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, below the Custom Databases heading, right-click the name of the database to which you will apply the AppHelp message, click Create New, and then click AppHelp Message.
segment.target: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, below the Custom Databases heading, right-click the name of the database to which you will apply the AppHelp message, click Create New, and then click AppHelp Message.

segment.source: Type the name of the application to which this AppHelp message applies, type the name of the application vendor, browse to the location of the application file (.exe) on your computer, and then click Next.
segment.target: Type the name of the application to which this AppHelp message applies, type the name of the application vendor, browse to the location of the application file (.exe) on your computer, and then click Next.

segment.source: The wizard shows the known Matching Information, which is used for program identification.
segment.target: The wizard shows the known Matching Information, which is used for program identification.

segment.source: Select any additional criteria to use to match your applications to the AppHelp message, and then click Next.
segment.target: Select any additional criteria to use to match your applications to the AppHelp message, and then click Next.

segment.source: By default, Compatibility Administrator selects the basic matching criteria for your application.
segment.target: By default, Compatibility Administrator selects the basic matching criteria for your application.

segment.source: The wizard shows the Enter Message Type options.
segment.target: The wizard shows the Enter Message Type options.

segment.source: Click one of the following options:
segment.target: Click one of the following options:

segment.source: Display a message and allow this program to run.
segment.target: Display a message and allow this program to run.

segment.source: This is a non-blocking message, which means that you can alert the user that there might be a problem, but the application is not prevented from starting.
segment.target: This is a non-blocking message, which means that you can alert the user that there might be a problem, but the application is not prevented from starting.

segment.source: Display a message and do not allow this program to run.
segment.target: Display a message and do not allow this program to run.

segment.source: This is a blocking message, which means that the application will not start.
segment.target: This is a blocking message, which means that the application will not start.

segment.source: Instead, this message points the user to a location that provides more information about fixing the issue.
segment.target: Instead, this message points the user to a location that provides more information about fixing the issue.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: The wizard then shows the Enter Message Information fields.
segment.target: The wizard then shows the Enter Message Information fields.

segment.source: Type the website URL and the message text to appear when the user starts the application, and then click Finish.
segment.target: Type the website URL and the message text to appear when the user starts the application, and then click Finish.

segment.source: Issues with AppHelp Messages and Computers Running Windows 2000
segment.target: Issues with AppHelp Messages and Computers Running Windows 2000

segment.source: The following issues might occur with computers running Windows 2000:
segment.target: The following issues might occur with computers running Windows 2000:

segment.source: You might be unable to create a custom AppHelp message.
segment.target: You might be unable to create a custom AppHelp message.

segment.source: The AppHelp message text used for system database entries might not appear.
segment.target: The AppHelp message text used for system database entries might not appear.

segment.source: Copying an AppHelp entry for a system database or a custom-compatibility fix from a system database might cause Compatibility Administrator to hide the descriptive text.
segment.target: Copying an AppHelp entry for a system database or a custom-compatibility fix from a system database might cause Compatibility Administrator to hide the descriptive text.

segment.target: Related topics
